title: Keeladi excavation—Tamil Nadu’s ancient city and a long trail of clues
description: In 'The Dig', Sowmiya Ashok traces the serendipitous discovery of the ancient settlement at Keeladi and the political storm it set off.

title: A moorland wander above ancient caves and big Dales views
description: Stump Cross Caverns, located on the B6265 between Pateley Bridge and Grassington, offers a scenic walking experience on the moors with panoramic views

title: The ancient practices to help your body and mind – and make life easier
description: How centuries-old Eastern wisdom can help with very modern problems

title: Country diary: There’s a hard, ancient pleasure to laying a hedge | Michael White
description: Cranbrook, Kent: I have a stretch of leggy hawthorn that needs attention, so I head out into the cold with my axe and billhookWire netting is everywhere in the Kent Weald – barbed boundaries to ancient pastures where sheep and cattle still idly graze. But what did farmers do for the hundreds of years before stock fencing was invented?Hedges, so rooted in what we wistfully consider to be our natural landscape, are in fact human-made features, planted almost solely for the purpose of enclosure. Unmanaged hedges are not a permanent solution, though: young trees mature, trunks become bare, and animal‐sized holes appear, rendering them useless. To remedy this, the practice of hedge laying was developed; unlike bricklaying, it is an act of maintenance rather than creation. Continue reading...

title: Study of fossil human teeth reveals diversity of Italian Iron Age diet
description: Italians began exploring a varied diet sometime between the 7th and 6th centuries BC, according to a new analysis of ancient teeth from Iron Age Italians.
